   1  # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 
   2  """ 
   3   
   4      @author: Fabio Erculiani <lxnay@sabayon.org> 
   5      @contact: lxnay@sabayon.org 
   6      @copyright: Fabio Erculiani 
   7      @license: GPL-2 
   8   
   9      B{Entropy Framework repository database module}. 
  10      Entropy repositories (server and client) are implemented as relational 
  11      databases. Currently, EntropyRepository class is the object that wraps 
  12      sqlite3 database queries and repository logic: there are no more 
  13      abstractions between the two because there is only one implementation 
  14      available at this time. In future, entropy.db will feature more backends 
  15      such as MySQL embedded, SparQL, remote repositories support via TCP socket, 
  16      etc. This will require a new layer between the repository interface now 
  17      offered by EntropyRepository and the underlying data retrieval logic. 
  18      Every repository interface available inherits from EntropyRepository 
  19      class and has to reimplement its own Schema subclass and its get_init 
  20      method (see EntropyRepository documentation for more information). 
  21   
  22      I{EntropyRepository} is the sqlite3 implementation of the repository 
  23      interface, as written above. 
  24   
  25  """

  56      """ 
  57      EntropyRepository implements SQLite3 based storage. In a Model-View based 
  58      pattern, it can be considered the "model". 
  59      Actually it's the only one available but more model backends will be 
  60      supported in future (which will inherit this class directly). 
  61   
  62      Every Entropy repository storage interface MUST inherit from this base 
  63      class. 
  64      """

 465 -    def _cleanup_stale_cur_conn(self, kill_all = False): 

 466   
 467          th_ids = [x.ident for x in threading.enumerate() if x.ident] 
 468   
 469          def kill_me(th_id, pid): 
 470              try: 
 471                  cur = self.__cursor_cache.pop((th_id, pid)) 
 472                  cur.close() 
 473              except KeyError: 
 474                  pass 
 475              try: 
 476                  conn = self.__connection_cache.pop((th_id, pid)) 
 477                  if not self.readOnly: 
 478                      try: 
 479                          conn.commit() 
 480                      except OperationalError: 
 481                          # no transaction is active can cause this, bleh! 
 482                          pass 
 483                  try: 
 484                      conn.close() 
 485                  except OperationalError: 
 486                      # heh, unable to close due to unfinalised statements 
 487                      # interpreter shutdown? 
 488                      pass 
 489              except KeyError: 
 490                  pass 

 491   
 492          th_data = set(self.__cursor_cache.keys()) 
 493          th_data |= set(self.__connection_cache.keys()) 
 494          for th_id, pid in th_data: 
 495              do_kill = False 
 496              if kill_all: 
 497                  do_kill = True 
 498              elif th_id not in th_ids: 
 499                  do_kill = True 
 500              elif not const_pid_exists(pid): 
 501                  do_kill = True 
 502              if do_kill: 
 503                  kill_me(th_id, pid)

 505 -    def _cursor(self): 

 506   
 507          # thanks to hotshot 
 508          # this avoids calling _cleanup_stale_cur_conn logic zillions of time 
 509          t1 = time.time() 
 510          if abs(t1 - self._cleanup_stale_cur_conn_t) > 3: 
 511              self._cleanup_stale_cur_conn() 
 512              self._cleanup_stale_cur_conn_t = t1 
 513   
 514          c_key = self._get_cur_th_key() 
 515          cursor = self.__cursor_cache.get(c_key) 
 516          if cursor is None: 
 517              conn = self._connection() 
 518              cursor = conn.cursor() 
 519              # !!! enable foreign keys pragma !!! do not remove this 
 520              # otherwise removePackage won't work properly 
 521              cursor.execute("pragma foreign_keys = 1") 
 522              self.__cursor_cache[c_key] = cursor 
 523              # memory databases are critical because every new cursor brings 
 524              # up a totally empty repository. So, enforce initialization. 
 525              if self.__db_path == ":memory:": 
 526                  self.initializeRepository() 
 527          return cursor
